findings.title: Missing Authentication in API Route
findings.description: The API route /api/users does not verify user authentication before returning sensitive data. An attacker could access user information without logging in.

evidence.label: Unauthenticated API handler

remediation.recommendedFix: Add authentication middleware to verify the user session before processing the request.

findings.title: SQL Injection Vulnerability
findings.description: User input is directly interpolated into SQL query without parameterization, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands.

evidence.label: SQL string interpolation

proof.summary: User input flows from API parameter to SQL query without sanitization

nodes.label: User ID received from request query parameter
ID passed to getUser() without validation
ID interpolated directly into SQL query

remediation.recommendedFix: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements instead of string interpolation.

findings.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) via dangerouslySetInnerHTML
findings.description: User-generated content is rendered using dangerouslySetInnerHTML without sanitization, enabling XSS attacks.

evidence.label: Unsanitized HTML rendering

remediation.recommendedFix: Sanitize HTML content using a library like DOMPurify before rendering.

findings.title: Hardcoded API Key in Source Code
findings.description: An API key is hardcoded in the source file. This could be exposed in version control or client bundles.

remediation.recommendedFix: Move secrets to environment variables and never commit them to version control.

findings.title: Unused Security Import: helmet
findings.description: The helmet security middleware is imported but never used, suggesting incomplete security implementation.

remediation.recommendedFix: Apply the helmet middleware to add security headers, or remove the unused import.

findings.title: Sensitive Data in Console Logs
findings.description: User passwords are being logged to the console, which could expose credentials in log files or monitoring systems.

remediation.recommendedFix: Remove sensitive data from log statements. Only log non-sensitive identifiers.

findings.title: Insecure Cookie Configuration
findings.description: Session cookies are configured without the Secure and HttpOnly flags, making them vulnerable to interception and XSS attacks.

evidence.label: Insecure session config

remediation.recommendedFix: Add secure cookie options to protect against common attacks.
